div.pre: 2008 Martina Franca, 25 km. N of Ta- (661) canto, Apulia, 1912 Burial: c. 228 B.C. (K) Contents: 178 AR, 272 AE Taras: 172 st. (Per. VII-IX, the latter fdc) Heracleia: 4 dr., fdc Metapontum: 1 dr.; 272 AE Thurium: 1 st. Disposition: Canessa, then part to J. Hirsch: Hirsch Nov. 17, 1913, 87-8, 123, 163, 169-83, 210; May 5, 1914, 49-53. New York 11 (?): SNGANS 2, 603 and very probably 559, 569, 573, 578-9, 581, 585, 588-9, 593 A note from Newell in the ANS describes a hd. of Metapontine AE, presumably a section of this hd., seen at Canessa in 1920: it included 13 coins as SNGANS 2, 559, 14 as 569, 1 as 580, 25 as 584, 4 as 588, 1 as 589, and 40 as 590. A note from Vlasto mentions the presence of earlier AE, much worn, and states that SNGANS 2, 603, was one of only two examples of this issue in the hd.
